lines.text: David Berkowitz, Ted Bundy, Richard Speck...
What about them?
Serial killers. Serial killers only have two names. You ever notice that? But lone gunmen assassins, they always have three names. John Wilkes Booth, Lee Harvey Oswald, Mark David Chapman...
John Hinckley. He shot Reagan. He only has two names.
Yeah, but he only just shot Reagan. Reagan didn't die. If Reagan had died, I'm pretty sure we probably would all know what John Hinckley's middle name was.

Love gives you wings. It makes you fly. I don't even call it love. I call it Geronimo. When you're in love, you'll jump right from the top of the Empire State and you won't care, screaming "Geronimo" the whole way down. I love her so bad, I just... whoa, she wrecks me. I'd die for her.
[Walking through a metal detector]
Why is this thing safe for me and not for my keys?
A good conspiracy is unprovable. I mean, if you can prove it, it means they screwed up somewhere along the line.
Have you ever been a place where hope was gone? Where all that's left is patience?
[about lone gunmen having three names each]
James Earl Ray, the guy who got Luther King. Then of course, there's Sirhan Sirhan. I still haven't figured that one out. Maybe it's Sirhan Sirhan Sirhan, I don't know.
I love you.
Jerry, no, no, you don't love me.
Sure I do.
No, no.
I don't?
To be normal, to drink Coca-Cola and eat Kentucky Fried Chicken is to be in a conspiracy against yourself.

[Speaking through the air ducts]
Where are you, Jerry?
I'm here.
Where's "here", Jerry?
On the floor.
What do we know? If I know what we know then I could tell you what we know and if anyone else knows!
He said a dog bit his nose.
Arf.
It's on the tip of my brain.
I'm only paranoid because they want me dead.
You can't hurt me any more.
I'll be the judge of that.
I love you, too.
Oh Alice... now you tell me.
If the intelligence community is a family, think of us as the uncle no one talks about.
This guy's a restraining order waiting to happen.
How did you know this was my car?
I didn't. It was just a lucky guess. Look, I feel kinda naked. Could we get outta here?
Please don't tell me you're naked back there.
No, it's just a figure of speech, could we go? Please?
Yeah, OK, OK.
[Communicating through the air ducts]
Jerry, I'm coming to get you.
Alice, Alice, You can fit through there?
[Before getting a needle]
What's that?
Gravy for the brain.
No! Not Gravy! Nooooooo!
[talking through vent]
Jerry?
Alice is that you?
Yes Jerry.
Oh Alice, I'm so sorry that you're dead.
GET BACK you damn, dumb, complicit sons of bitches! You're looking for a man with NO NOSE! Not me, not me!
[first lines]

July eighth, 1979, all the fathers of Nobel Prize winners were rounded up by United Nations military units, all right, and actually forced at gunpoint to give semen samples in little plastic jars, which are now stored below Rockefeller Center underneath the ice skating rink...
[last lines]

[starts singing]
I need you, baby. To warm the lonely nights...
... Oh pretty baby... ]
We got a future.

[to himself, while eating hospital oatmeal]
What a grueling experience.

[after seeing a painting of herself on horseback in Jerry's apartment]
What was that?
That was here when I moved in.
[Alice is looking at the firewall material on the wall in Jerry's apartment as Jerry balances a bottle on the door knob]
Is this supposed to protect you from aliens or something?
No, no, it's just a beer bottle.
I am an American citizen, and I demand to see Alice Sutton.
The Vietnam War was fought over a bet that Howard Hughes lost to Aristotle Onassis.
See this aluminum-looking stuff? It's firewall. It's amazing. The guy designed this place so it could be an incinerator, but it leaves the rest of the building untouched.
If you could remember who stabbed you with the wheelchair, and where it happened it would really help.

That's what they, they start when you're young, y'know. When you're little they, at school they, they Baden-Powell all the boys and they Betty Crocker all the girls and they, then they air condition ya' and put ya' in the Heat N' Bake Oven and ya' can't breathe any more.

[on the experiments that he had performed]
... And it all ended when John Hinckley shot Ronald Reagan...
[notices look on Alice's face]
...That wasn't us.
Years ago I worked for the CIA on the MK ULTRA program. Are you familiar with it?
It was mind control. "Manchurian Candidate" kind of stuff.
That's a vulgar generalization. But yes, you take an ordinary man an turn him into an assassin. That was our goal.
There he goes! Open the goddamn gate! Open the gate!
No! And you watch your language!
FBI, lady, open the damn door!
In one hour, I want to know where she eats, where she sleeps, the name of her kindergarten teacher, everything.
It involved hallucinogenic research, elektroshock to induce vegetative states, terminal experiments in sensory deprivation.
Terminal?
Terminal, as in "resulting in death".
MK ULTRA was science, sanctioned by the government.
